profiles.default: Solution Architect with 3+ years of experience at Allianz Global Investors, specialising in financial systems implementation, data analytics, and process automation. Led the successful deployment of MSCI BarraOne for global Fixed Income teams, engineered custom performance attribution models, and pioneered AI adoption across operations. Strong technical skills in Python, SQL, and Power BI combined with deep domain expertise in fixed income and investment operations.
profiles.portfolio-risk: Quantitative professional with a Physics and Mathematics background from UCL, combining analytical rigour with practical implementation experience. Led the technical implementation of MSCI BarraOne across global Fixed Income teams at Allianz Global Investors, delivering a multi-year system transformation that saved over £500,000 in development and maintenance costs. Seeking a Portfolio Analytics or Risk role where I can apply my expertise in performance attribution, risk modelling, and data-driven decision making.
profiles.client-solutions: Technical implementation specialist with a strong analytical foundation from UCL (Physics and Mathematics). At Allianz Global Investors, I led the successful delivery of MSCI BarraOne across global Fixed Income teams—completing a transformation that had failed twice previously over seven years. I thrive at the intersection of technology and client needs, translating complex requirements into scalable solutions. Seeking a Client Solutions or Implementation role where I can drive successful system deployments and deliver measurable value to clients.
profiles.ai-ml: Machine learning practitioner with a Physics and Mathematics background from UCL, experienced in deploying AI solutions that deliver business impact. At Allianz Global Investors, I pioneered AI adoption by building a chatbot trained on company data and computer vision modules for document automation, while identifying 50+ use cases for agentic AI. Currently developing NutriPlan, an AI-powered nutrition app using GPT-4o, RAG pipelines, and vector embeddings for personalised meal planning. Seeking an AI/ML Engineering role where I can design, build, and scale intelligent systems.
profiles.data-science: Data scientist with a quantitative foundation in Physics and Mathematics from UCL, skilled at extracting insights from complex datasets and building data-driven solutions. At Allianz Global Investors, I engineered performance attribution models and 20+ automated reports using Python, SQL and Power BI, delivering £25,000 savings per report and £15,000 annually in reduced maintenance. Passionate about applying statistical methods and machine learning to solve business problems. Seeking a Data Science role where I can turn data into actionable insights and measurable impact.
profiles.quant-dev: Quantitative developer with a Physics and Mathematics background from UCL, combining strong mathematical foundations with production-grade programming skills. Developed algorithmic trading strategies in Python that outperformed the S&P 500 by 67%, and engineered performance attribution systems processing multi-billion pound portfolios at Allianz Global Investors. Experienced in stochastic methods, statistical modelling, and building robust analytical pipelines. Seeking a Quant Development role where I can apply mathematical and computational skills to trading systems and quantitative finance.
profiles.research: Research-focused analyst with a Physics and Mathematics background from UCL, combining rigorous analytical training with practical financial markets experience. As Head of Fixed Income at NF Capital, I led a team producing research reports in Rates, Credit and FX that directly influenced investment committee decisions. At Allianz Global Investors, I developed performance attribution models and analytical frameworks for global Fixed Income teams. Seeking a Research or Analysis role where I can apply deep analytical skills to generate actionable insights.
profiles.software-eng: Software engineer with a Physics and Mathematics background from UCL, experienced in building full-stack applications and data systems. Developing two iOS apps: Lineup (concert tracking with multi-source data pipeline) and NutriPlan (AI-powered meal planning with FastAPI backend). At Allianz Global Investors, I engineered automated workflows and 20+ production reports using Python, SQL and Power BI, saving £500,000+ in costs. Seeking a Software Engineering role where I can design and build systems that deliver real user value.

bullets.text: Led the technical implementation of the MSCI BarraOne system for all global Fixed Income teams and decommissioning of 3 legacy systems, successfully completing a project previously attempted 2 times in the 7 years prior
bullets.metrics: Completed project attempted 2 times in 7 years

bullets.text: Engineered custom performance attribution models, workflows and 20+ reports using Python, SQL and Power BI with data from BarraOne and Databricks, saving £25,000 per report for development and £15,000 in annual maintenance
bullets.metrics: £25K saved per report, £15K annual maintenance savings

bullets.text: Managed a cross-functional team of 9 analysts and external SMEs to deliver the BarraOne performance attribution migration, ensuring seamless integration with investment systems and alignment with business objectives
Collaborated with senior portfolio managers and cross-departmental stakeholders to translate investment and risk requirements into scalable technical solutions and architecture decisions
Designed and implemented low-code/no-code applications on Microsoft Power Platform, consulting with business units to identify automation opportunities and define optimal solution architectures

Developed a Power BI dashboard for quarterly UK Board reporting on retail client activity in line with the consumer duty regulation, providing senior executives with the latest performance insights and data-driven decision support

Reviewed vendor proposals worth over £3 million for the implementation of AI agents and Generative AI use cases, assessing architecture quality, delivery approach, and ROI potential to advise senior leadership

Directed the training and education workstream for the AI in Operations initiative, hosting sessions with industry experts and consultants to upskill ~200 senior managers and operations professionals on AI strategy and applications
Pioneered the adoption of generative/agentic AI in Operations by identifying 50+ use cases across different teams
Automated 4/4 data reconciliation processes for an internal portfolio management application vs custodian data using SQL and VBA, enabling a reduction of over £200,000 pa in external spend
Collaborated with a team of 3 analysts to produce research reports in Rates, Credit and FX, influencing fixed income investment decisions presented to the investment committee
Developed machine learning-focused Python exercises, applying ML concepts to interdisciplinary science use cases
Presented my work, alongside my partner, to 200+ professors and peers with an explanation tailored to the audience
Ranked 2nd out of 70+ interns with +23.4% annual return in the equity portfolio management simulation
Developed an algorithmic trading strategy in Python using a combination of SMAs that outperformed the S&P 500 buy and hold strategy by 67% (Jun 2019 - Jun 2020)

education.degree: BSc Natural Sciences (Physics and Mathematics & Statistics)

education.institution: Brighton, Hove & Sussex Sixth Form College
education.degree: A-Levels: Mathematics (A*), Further Mathematics (A), Physics (B), Chemistry (A)

certifications.name: L6 Diploma in Trading and Financial Market Analysis

interests: Football (former semi-pro and UCL 1st XI Captain)

extra_curricular.description: A-Level and GCSE Mathematics and Science (100% A* success rate)

extra_curricular.activity: UCL Sports Representative and Football Club President

extra_curricular.description: Improved donor detail retention from 25% to 90%

lineup.name: Lineup
lineup.description: Concert and event tracking iOS app with multi-source data pipeline
lineup.summary_short: Full-stack iOS app for tracking concerts with automated data pipeline aggregating 6+ event sources
lineup.summary_medium: Native iOS concert tracking app with Python data pipeline. Aggregates events from Ticketmaster, Spotify, Skiddle, and Resident Advisor with cross-source artist deduplication using MusicBrainz IDs

tech_stack.architecture: Supabase-first (direct SDK, no custom API layer)

key_features: Multi-source event aggregation from 6 APIs (Ticketmaster, Spotify, Skiddle, Resident Advisor, Concert Archives, MusicBrainz)
Cross-source artist deduplication using MusicBrainz IDs as canonical identifiers
Automated data pipeline with scheduled syncs deployed on Railway.app
Direct Supabase architecture eliminating custom API layer
ISO-standard location handling (ISO 3166-1/3166-2) with timezone inference
Event tracking (watchlist, going, attended) with user statistics
technical_highlights: Sophisticated deduplication algorithm matching artists across 6+ different APIs with different ID schemes
Supabase-first architecture using Row Level Security for data isolation
Automated venue geocoding and timezone inference from coordinates
Image quality optimization prioritizing high-resolution Spotify images (640x640px)
MVVM architecture with SwiftUI and direct Supabase SDK integration

nutriplan.name: NutriPlan
nutriplan.description: AI-powered meal planning iOS app with personalised nutrition
nutriplan.summary_short: AI-powered meal planning app using GPT-4o and vector embeddings for personalised weekly meal plans
nutriplan.summary_medium: Full-stack nutrition app with FastAPI backend and SwiftUI frontend. Uses GPT-4o for meal plan generation with RAG pipeline, pgvector embeddings for preference learning, and UK-standard nutrition calculations
key_features: AI meal plan generation using GPT-4o with structured JSON output
Vector similarity search (pgvector) for candidate meal retrieval (~100 meals per generation)
Preference learning from user feedback using embedding updates
UK-standard nutrition calculations (Henry/Oxford equations per SACN guidelines)
Smart meal swapping with intelligent alternatives
Household meal coordination with individual portion calculations
Multi-stage onboarding (free calorie tracking → premium meal planning)
technical_highlights: RAG pipeline: context loading → target calculation → candidate retrieval → LLM optimization → portion calculation
Vector embeddings (text-embedding-3-small) for meal recommendations and preference learning
Calorie targeting within ±10% accuracy with macro distribution
14-day meal history consideration to avoid repetition
LiteLLM abstraction for model flexibility (GPT-4o primary, GPT-4o-mini for cost optimization)
Comprehensive API with meal plans, swapping, feedback, and nutrition endpoints
